Dear Yulonda Shell:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the violations
identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15
days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM, and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• Indicate how continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• Be signed and dated.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. In
any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager Samantha Way at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Shannon (Shay) Mavis, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Title & (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Section statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
Description (c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff pulled bonnet of youth's head and spit on youth.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Attempts were made to interview Youth A face to face at the
facility on 1/16/25 in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Youth
A refused to be interviewed despite multiple attempts made during
this visit.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 1/8/25 in
coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported Youth A
took his hat, and he took Youth A’s bonnet in a playful way, not a
malicious way. Staff 1 reported there was no escalation or
physical management at the time. Staff 1 reported things then
escalated, but he and Youth A exchanged the hat and bonnet
back after being de-escalated by an unknown female staff. Staff 1
reported Youth A spit on him, but he never spit on Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 1/8/25 in
coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported Youth A spit
at Staff 1 and it got on Staff 1’s hand. Staff 2 reported Staff 1
never spit at or on Youth A. Staff 2 reported Youth A took Staff 1’s
hat and Staff 1 took Youth A’s bonnet, but they gave them back to
each other. Staff 2 reported he couldn’t tell if they were playing
around or not but noted Youth A appeared to be more aggressive
during the exchange.
Staff 3 was interviewed via video conference on 1/14/25 in
coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported Youth A was
escalated on the unit. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 came onto the unit
and Youth A started running towards him like she was going to
fight him. Staff 3 reported Youth A was very aggressive and
snatched Staff 1’s hat off his head. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 then
took Youth A’s bonnet off her head. Staff 3 reported neither of
them were playing around or joking when this occurred. Staff 3
reported she tried to de-escalate the situation. Staff 3 reported
Youth A told Staff 1 she was going to spit on him and Staff 1
replied he would spit on Youth A right back. Staff 3 reported Youth
2

A proceeded to spit on Staff 1 and Staff 1 spit on Youth A in
retaliation.
VIDEO REVIEWED:
Video footage from 1/6/25 was reviewed. It should be noted the
video does not have any audio. Youth A stands by one of the
doors in the hallway and looks in the window. Staff 1 enters the
hallway right behind her, while Staff 3 stands at the entrance to
the hallway and Staff 2 remains in C-wing. Staff 1 stands right
next to Youth A. Youth A turns her body away from Staff 1, faces
the wall and puts the sheet inside her shirt. Then she turns back
around and puts her hand on the door handle right by Staff 1.
Youth A lets go of the door handle and quickly snatches Staff 1’s
hat off his head. Staff 1 then proceeds to snatch Youth A’s bonnet
off her head. Youth A puts Staff 1’s hat inside her shirt.
Later in the video, Youth A spits on Staff 1, and Staff 1 launches
himself forward towards her and pushes her into the wall while still
holding onto her wrist. Shortly after, all three staff back up and
Youth A advances towards Staff 1 again. Staff 1 holds out his
hand and blocks Youth A from spitting on him again. Staff 1 backs
up but continues to put his hand inches away from Youth A’s face
and waves it. Youth A grabs Staff 1’s hand and pushes it down,
but he puts it up again, and Youth A pushes it down again (this
happens multiple times). Youth A spits on Staff 1 again, and Staff
1 advances towards her and pushes Youth A against the wall
again. A little bit later, Staff 1 puts his hand inches away from
Youth A’s face, and Youth A pushes his hand away. Youth A spits
at Staff 1 again and it looks like Staff 1 tries to push Youth A’s
head, but Youth A has a hold of Staff 1’s arms so he’s unable to.
Staff 1 is not seen spitting on Youth A during the video. However,
due to the camera angle and Staff’s bodies in relation to the
camera angle, there are some blind points in the video where it is
unknown what is occurring.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Incident report dated 1/6/25 authored by Staff 2 does not
have any information regarding Youth A and Staff 1 spitting
or about either of them snatching the other’s bonnet/hat.
• Youth A’s Safety Plan states staff are to remain calm in
their presentation and model possible body-based self-
regulation techniques. Staff are to structure the
environment and set healthy limits. Staff are to use calm
tones and supportive words while verbally de-escalating
Youth A.
3

• Vista Maria Staff and Client Interaction policy states staff
should conduct themselves in a professional and
appropriate manner when interacting with youth.
Employees are expected to establish good working
relationships to foster mutual trust with youth.
• Staff 1 had 3 disciplinary actions in his employee file
unrelated to this incident. Staff 1 was terminated on 1/8/25
because of this incident. Staff 1 completed Employee
Training Guide on 7/1/24 & 7/2/24.
Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as per interviews
conducted, video reviewed, and documentation reviewed, Staff 1
was inappropriate in his interactions with Youth A by snatching her
bonnet off her head after she snatched his hat. It is clear from the
video the situation between Youth A and Staff 1 was already
escalated when this interaction occurred.
Although Youth A is seen spitting on Staff 1 in the video, the video
does not clearly show Staff 1 spitting on Youth A. Staff 1 and Staff
2 report Staff 1 did not spit on Youth A, while Staff 3 reports the
opposite. Since the video footage is not clear and Youth A refused
to be interviewed, there is not enough information to support Staff
1 spit on Youth A.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

Rule Code CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title & (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Section policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
Description intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff dragged youth off of the unit.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Attempts were made to interview Youth A face to face at the
facility on 1/16/25 in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Youth
A refused to be interviewed despite multiple attempts made during
this visit.
4

Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 1/8/25 in
coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported Youth A was
on D-wing and got into a verbal altercation with Youth B. Staff 1
reported they were calling each other racial slurs, which upset the
other youth on the D-wing. Staff 1 reported he and Staff 2 were
attempting to get Youth A back to C-wing, but she fell on the floor
and said she didn’t want to leave because she wanted to fight
Youth B. Staff 1 reported she sat on the floor, and they scooted
her to C-wing and closed the door. Staff 1 reported it was Youth A
scooting on the floor, and he was standing behind her and
encouraging her to keep going. Staff 1 reported he and Staff 2
never dragged Youth A off the unit. Staff 1 reported a little while
later, Staff 1 entered C-wing again due to Youth A being
escalated. Staff 1 reported Youth A tried to bite his forearm and
punch him, so he used his arm to push Youth A back to keep her
separated from him.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 1/8/25 in
coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported the incident
began on D-wing with Youth A trying to fight another youth. Staff 2
reported Youth A was supposed to go back to C-wing, but Youth A
had an attitude and refused to go. Staff 2 reported Youth A was
standing, so he and Staff 1 stood on either side of Youth A, each
grabbed one of her arms, and escorted her to C-wing. Staff 2
reported they never dragged her, and she wasn’t on the ground at
any point moving from D-wing to C-wing. Staff 2 reported Staff 1
never pushed or shoved Youth A and never held Youth A against
the wall.
Staff 3 was interviewed via video conference on 1/14/25 in
coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported Youth A
went to the bathroom on D-wing and refused to go back to C-wing.
Staff 3 reported Youth A was upset and began hitting the walls on
the unit. Staff 3 reported Youth A went down onto the floor. Staff 3
reported Staff 1 and Staff 2 stood on either side of Youth A,
looped their arms through her arms, and dragged her to C-wing
while Youth A had her knees dragging on the floor. Staff 3
reported she was on another wing and only saw a bit of the
situation before they went out of her sight. Staff 3 reported a little
while later, Youth A wouldn’t calm down on C-wing. Staff 3
reported Staff 1 arrived to assist because he was the team lead on
duty. Staff 3 reported Youth A began hitting Staff 1, and Staff 1
pushed Youth A against the multipurpose room door and told her
to calm down.
5

VIDEO REVIEWED:
Video footage from 1/6/25 was reviewed. It should be noted the
video does not have any audio. Youth A was pushed multiple
times during this incident, which are described below.
The video shows C-wing. The door connecting C-wing to D-wing
is open with a staff (unknown) holding the door open. Staff 1
comes into the camera view, and he jumps out of the way of
someone kicking. Then it appears Staff 1 is pulling, but what he is
pulling cannot be seen. Staff 1 and Staff 2 are behind Youth A
pushing her from behind while she is seated, and they’re each
holding one of her hands/wrists. They drop her hands/wrists and
continue to push Youth A all the way onto C wing.
Staff 1 puts each of his hands around each of Youth A’s arms to
hold them at her sides. Youth A kicks Staff 1 once. When Youth A
tries to kick Staff 1 again, he continues to hold onto her arms and
pushes her backwards. When Staff 1 pushes Youth A, he quickly
releases her, and she stumbles backwards. She catches herself
against the wall with her arm.
Youth A moves away from the wall and attempts to walk past Staff
1, but Staff 1 grabs her upper arms and pushes her backwards
into the door. Youth A tries to fight back and then Staff 1 uses his
elbow/arm and body to body check Youth A into the wall. Youth A
slides down the wall and sits on the floor. Staff 3’s body is
blocking the camera view so there’s no ability to see what is
happening between Youth A and Staff 1. However, Youth A
remains on the floor and Staff 1 is standing and bending over her.
Staff 3 moves backwards, and the camera shows Youth A on the
floor while Staff 1 has a hand on her holding her down. Youth A
gets out of Staff 1’s grasp, kneels on the floor, sits on her feet and
begins hitting Staff 1. Staff 1 then pushes Youth A down so she’s
kneeling on the floor again, and Staff 1 uses his hand to hold her
down again.
Staff 1, and Staff 2 back up, Youth A gets up from the floor, stands
up and advances towards Staff 1 again. She attempts to hit Staff
1, but Staff 1 grabs both of her wrists and prevents her from hitting
him. Youth A spits on Staff 1, and Staff 1 launches himself forward
towards her and pushes her into the wall while still holding onto
her wrist. Youth A punches Staff 1, and Staff 1 then pushes Youth
A against the door. Youth A and Staff 1 fight against each other
with both of their arms flailing towards each other while Staff 1 still
6

has Youth A pushed against the door. Staff 2 and Staff 3 try to
intervene and get between them.
Youth A spits on Staff 1 again, and Staff 1 advances towards her
and pushes Youth A against the wall again. Staff 1 holds Youth
A’s wrists and twists his body, so his forearm is against Youth A,
pushing her into the door and then guiding her down to the floor.
Youth A attempts to hit Staff 1, but Staff 1 bends over and pushes
Youth A down to the floor so she’s laying on her side. A little later,
Staff 1 maneuvers himself behind Youth A, grabs her arms from
behind her and pushes her front towards the wall.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Incident report dated 1/6/25 authored by Staff 2 does not
have any information regarding Youth A being dragged or
moved from D-wing to C-wing. It also does not have any
information about Youth A being pushed, hit or pulled.
• Youth A’s Safety Plan states staff are to remain calm in
their presentation and model possible body-based self-
regulation techniques. Staff are to structure the
environment and set healthy limits. Staff are to use calm
tones and supportive words while verbally de-escalating
Youth A.
• Vista Maria Staff and Client Interaction policy states
corporal punishment (spanking, paddling, slapping,
pinching, twisting arms, pulling hair, etc.) of youth is never,
under any circumstances, permitted.
• Vista Maria Behavior Management Policy states behavior
management interventions will not be used as a form of
discipline, to force compliance, or for the convenience of
staff.
• Staff 1 had 3 disciplinary actions in his employee file
unrelated to this incident. Staff 1 was terminated on 1/8/25
because of this incident. Staff 1 completed CPI training
(6/24/24 & 6/25/24) and Employee Training Guide (7/1/24 &
7/2/24).
• Staff 2 has 5 disciplinary actions in his employee file
unrelated to this incident. Staff 2 completed CPI training
(10/2/24 & 10/3/24) and Employee Training Guide
(10/16/24).
7

Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as per interviews
conducted, video reviewed, and documentation reviewed, Staff 1
and Staff 2 pushed Youth A from D-wing to C-wing while she was
sitting on the floor, when she refused to move on her own.
In addition, according to video footage, Staff 1 pushed and pulled
Youth A multiple times throughout the incident. Staff 1 and Staff 3
reported Staff 1 used his arm to push Youth A away from him,
which the video confirmed Staff 1 did multiple times.
Technical Assistance
The facility should consider adding the specific actions in the
subsection of this rule (i.e. throwing, kicking, pushing, pulling) as
prohibited practices under their Staff and Client Interaction policy.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

SIR #2024C0001153SI dated 3/25/24; CAP approved 4/22/24
Rule Code CCI Rule 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction,
Title & prevention; prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Section (5) In the event a restraint occurs, it must be performed in a
Description manner that is safe, appropriate, and proportionate to the severity
of the youth's behavior, chronological and developmental age,
size, gender, physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric
condition, and personal history, including any history of trauma,
and must be done in a manner consistent with the youth's
treatment plan.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The staff members restrained the youth by grabbing the youth's
ankles and holding her arms crossed.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Attempts were made to interview Youth A face to face at the
facility on 1/16/25 in coordination with MDHHS Worker. Youth
A refused to be interviewed despite multiple attempts made during
this visit.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 1/8/25 in
coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported if youth are
doing something wrong or dangerous, they are required to utilize
8

CPI for de-escalation and/or restraints. Staff 1 reported he was
last trained in CPI in June 2024 during onboarding. Staff 1
reported after Youth A went from D-wing to C-wing after almost
having an altercation with Youth B, Youth A hit Staff 1 and got
physical with him. Staff 1 reported Youth A was also hitting Staff 2.
Staff 1 reported Youth A is frequently aggressive towards staff.
Staff 1 reported due to her assaults on staff, he and Staff 2
attempted to restrain Youth A in a two-person management hold
where Staff 1 had Youth A’s left arm and Staff 2 had her right arm.
Staff 1 reported amid he and Staff 2 attempting to restrain Youth
A, Youth A dropped to the floor. Staff 1 reported Youth A was
mad, was yelling at them and was crying. Staff 1 reported after
Youth A was on the floor, he and Staff 2 left her alone because
she appeared to be de-escalating. Staff 1 reported since Youth A
was calm on the floor, he left C-wing. Staff 1 reported he came
back to C-wing a bit later because staff on the wing called a
“clear” because Youth A was escalated again. Staff 1 reported
when he entered C-wing, Youth A tried to bite his forearm and
punch him again, so he used his arm to push her back to keep her
separated from him. Staff 1 reported Staff 3 attempted to verbally
de-escalate Youth A, but it wasn’t working. Staff 1 reported Staff 2
kept trying to get in between Youth A and Staff 1 because Youth A
kept attacking Staff 1. Staff 1 reported Youth A eventually calmed
down, and he left the wing. Staff 1 reported he and Staff 2 never
restrained Youth A on the floor, never tried to stop her movements
while she was on the floor, never held her arms across her body,
and never restrained her by grabbing her ankles.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 1/8/25 in
coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported he has been
employed at the facility since September 2024. Staff 2 reported if
youth are escalated or doing something dangerous, staff are to
talk to them to try to de-escalate them or take away privileges.
Staff 2 reported after Youth A went from D-wing to C-wing, she
began hitting him. Staff 2 reported he grabbed Youth A’s wrists to
stop her from hitting him. Staff 2 reported Youth A dropped to the
floor, and she kept trying to kick him, so he held her ankles for a
minute while she was on the floor so she would stop kicking. Staff
2 reported he let go of Youth A’s ankles, and he and Staff 1
walked away from Youth A while she was still on the ground. Staff
2 reported he and Staff 1 did not try to restrain her or hold her
down on the floor. Staff 2 reported he and Staff 1 did not try any
type of restraint during any part of the incident. Staff 2 reported
after Youth A was on the floor for a bit, she began to calm down,
so Staff 1 left C-wing. Staff 2 reported he and a female staff
(doesn’t remember who) were left on C-wing with Youth A. Staff 2
9

reported Youth A got up and began hitting the windows to the
multipurpose room. Staff 2 reported he and Staff 3 were trying to
talk to her to stop her from hitting the windows. Staff 2 reported
Youth A turned around and grabbed the strings of his hoodie, and
Staff 2 removed Youth A’s hands from the strings. Staff 2 reported
he and Staff 3 called a “clear”, which is how staff request extra
help. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 was the team lead, so he came from
another building to assist. Staff 2 reported Youth A tried to attack
Staff 1 repeatedly, and Staff 1 tried to escape her. Staff 2 reported
they tried to give Youth A space, but she kept attacking them.
Staff 2 reported Youth A wouldn’t accept any help they tried to
provide, and asked them to stop talking to her, so they did. Staff 2
reported they continued to dodge Youth A’s hits and her kicks until
she stopped. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 never pushed or shoved
Youth A, never held Youth A against the wall, and never
inappropriately restrained Youth A.
Staff 3 was interviewed via video conference on 1/14/25 in
coordination with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported she arrived
on C-wing approximately 10 minutes after Staff 1 and Staff 2
dragged Youth A from D-wing to C-wing. Staff 3 reported when
she arrived on D-wing, Youth A was escalated, so Staff 3
immediately tried to verbally de-escalate her. Staff 3 reported Staff
2 was the only staff on C-wing when she arrived. Youth A told
Staff 3 she didn’t want Staff 2 in the room. Staff 2 told Staff 3
Youth A threw water on him. Staff 3 reported Youth A wouldn’t
calm down, and shortly after Staff 1 arrived to assist because he
was the team lead on duty. Staff 3 reported Youth A began hitting
Staff 1, and Staff 1 pushed Youth A against the multipurpose room
door and told her to calm down. Staff 3 reported she continued to
try to verbally de-escalate Youth A. Staff 3 reported Youth A tried
to fight Staff 1, but she fell on the floor, so she began kicking Staff
1 instead. Staff 3 reported Staff 1 and Staff 2 grabbed Youth A’s
ankles after she fell on the floor. Staff 3 reported she knew it was
wrong for them to grab Youth A’s ankles as it was against CPI, but
Staff 1 was the team lead and he reported he was handling it, so
Staff 3 felt she couldn’t go against him since he was her superior.
Staff 3 reported Staff 1 and Staff 2 released Youth A, and Youth A
stood up and started swinging at them again. Staff 3 reported after
the altercation ended, Youth A asked for ice for her hand and a
glass of water. Staff 3 reported she didn’t want to leave Youth A
alone with Staff 1 and Staff 2, so Staff 3 asked if Staff 1 or Staff 2
could get the ice and water for Youth A. Staff 3 reported Staff 1
stated Youth A wasn’t getting ice or water, and Staff 3 felt she
couldn’t override his direction since he was the team lead.
10

VIDEO REVIEWED:
Video footage from 1/6/25 was reviewed. It should be noted the
video does not have any audio. There are multiple incidents of
physical management during this incident, and each are described
below.
After Youth A is pushed onto C-wing, she remains seated and
turns around to try and swing her arm at Staff 1. Staff 1 holds her
arms and pushes her onto her side laying on the ground. Staff 1
holds both of her arms in front of her body, across her chest. Then
he lays down on top of her side perpendicular to her body while he
is still holding her arms. Staff 2 is standing above them watching.
Staff 1 pushes Youth A’s arms towards the ground, and Staff 2
comes around (in front of the camera view) and squats down in
front of Youth A. Youth A’s upper body and face cannot be seen.
Since Staff 2 is blocking the camera view, it is unknown what Staff
1 and Staff 2 are doing; however, Staff 1 remains laying on Youth
A’s side. Youth A begins kicking her legs at Staff 2, so he moves
out of the camera view, and it is seen Staff 1 and Staff 2 are
holding Youth A’s arms while Staff 1 remains laying on top of
Youth A while she is laying on her side on the floor. Staff 2
releases Youth A’s arms/wrists and stands up. Then Staff 1
stands up, but remains holding onto Youth A’s wrists/arms, which
causes Youth A to lay on her back. Staff 1 then quickly releases
Youth A’s wrists/arms and steps backwards away from her. Youth
A quickly sits up and reaches for Staff 2. Staff 2 blocks Youth A
from grabbing him. Staff 2 takes a couple of steps backwards.
Staff 1 steps forwards to Youth A. Youth A stands up. Staff 2
continues to step backwards away from Youth A, while Staff 1
continues to step towards Youth A. Youth A pushes Staff 1 while
Staff 1 attempts to block her. Youth A takes a couple steps
forward towards Staff 1. Staff 1 puts each of his hands around
each of Youth A’s arms to hold them at her sides. Youth A kicks
Staff 1 once. When Youth A tries to kick Staff 1 again, he
continues to hold onto her arms and pushes her backwards. When
Staff 1 pushes Youth A, he quickly releases her, and she stumbles
backwards. She catches herself against the wall with her arm.
Staff 2 walks around Youth A and stands closer to Staff 1. Youth A
pushes off the wall and begins advancing towards Staff 1 and
raises her arm at him. Staff 1 puts both his hands out and grabs
Youth A’s wrists. Staff 1 continues to hold her wrists while Youth A
struggles. Staff 2 turns around and moves a rolling chair out of the
way. Youth A gets one of her wrists out of Staff 1’s grasp, and
11

steps backwards. Staff 1 releases Youth A’s other wrist and takes
a step back with his hands still outstretched in front of him.
Youth A continues advancing towards Staff 2. Staff 2 holds Youth
A’s wrists and keeps his arms out to keep Youth A at a distance.
Youth A gets one of her wrists out of Staff 2’s grip, and then hits
Staff 2’s other hand, which caused him to release her other wrist.
Staff 2 then tries to get away from Youth A. Youth A advances on
Staff 2 again and Staff 2 grabs her wrists with his hands again.
Staff 3 picks up a bag off the floor and walks it towards the staff
observation area door. Youth A continues to advance on Staff 2
and backs him into a corner of the room. Staff 2 continues to grab
Youth A’s wrists/arms with his hands while also continuing to back
up trying to move away from Youth A.
Youth A puts her finger on Staff 1’s forehead. Staff 1 swats Youth
A’s finger off his forehead and then holds Youth A’s wrists. Staff 3
comes over and uses her hands to release Staff 1’s hands from
Youth A’s wrists.
Youth A attempts to hit Staff 1 again, but Staff 2 and Staff 3 block
her hits and grab Youth A’s wrist to prevent her hits. Youth A
stops trying to hit Staff 1 and refocuses on trying to get the bonnet
out of Staff 1’s hand. Staff 1 does not let go of the bonnet, so
Youth A then tries to bite Staff 1’s hand. When that doesn’t work,
Youth A raises her hand to hit Staff 1, but Staff 1 and Staff 3 block
her. Staff 1 holds Youth A’s wrist and pins it above her head
against the wall for a second before Youth A squirms and brings
her arm down. Staff 1 is still holding onto Youth A’s wrist and
brings Youth A’s arm so it’s around her neck and Staff 1 holds it
there briefly. Youth A is in the corner by the wall/door and Staff 1
is in front of her, which blocks the camera angle. Staff 1 is
blocking Youth A into the corner. It’s clear they’re still struggling,
but their hands and arms can’t be seen. Staff 2 and Staff 3 are
right next to them and try to intervene. Youth A tries to hit Staff 1,
but Staff 1 grabs her wrist and backs her further into the corner,
with him very close to her. Staff 1 takes a couple steps back and
Youth A advances forward. Staff 3 tries to put her arm between
them. Youth A gets the bonnet out of Staff 1’s hand, raises her
arm and hits him. Staff 3 tries again to get in between them. Youth
A backs up, and Staff 1 releases Youth A’s wrist, so they are
complete separate. Youth A then swings her arm and hits Staff 2
who is beside her. Youth A remains standing in the corner with
Staff 1, Staff 2 and Staff 3 surrounding her. Youth A moves away
from the wall and attempts to walk past Staff 1, but Staff 1 grabs
her upper arms and pushes her backwards into the door. Youth A
12

tries to fight back and then Staff 1 uses his elbow/arm and body to
